name: battery production, Li-ion, NMC811, rechargeable, prismatic | battery, Li-ion, NMC811, rechargeable, prismatic | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24904/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of Li-ion battery pack used e.g. for mechanical drive of an electric vehicle. The inventory is modelled according to the publication of Dai et al. (2017; 2018), in which a battery pack of 158 kg, with gross pack energy of 23.53 kWh made of 140 3.6 V- 46Ah prismatic cells is presented. Cells are made of nicke-manganese-cobalt (NMC811) cathode and a silicon coated graphite-based anode, liquid electrolyte and a porous plastic separator.Infrastructure is included as well in this dataset as "electronic component factory".;Reference:;Dai, Q., Dunn, J., Kelly, J. C., & Elgowainy, A. (2017). Update of Life Cycle Analysis of Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2017. Argonne National Laboratory.;Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.

The activity starts with the battery cells, module packaging and the materials for additional components (esternal case, tabs, etc.) entering the factory gate.

The activity ends with the production of Li-ion battery pack.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2017 (year of the collection of data) and 2020 (year of the dataset)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset covers the geography China, which is the leader country of Li-ion battery production. Data have been partly collected form a Chinese company.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The battery pack includes module packaging, cells with NMC811 cathode and silicon coated graphite-based anode and additional components (external case, tabs, electronic components).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: From Literature. Data on battery materials have been entirely retrieved from Dai et al. 2018 (see published source field). The bill of materials has been modelled following the battery scheme presented in Dai et al. 2019 (Life cycle analysis of lithium-ion batteries for automotive applications. Batteries, 5(2), 48). The information on the energy consumption for battery assembly come from Siret et al. (2018), which is the report on Product Environmental Footprint Category Rules for High Specific Energy Rechargeable Batteries for Mobile Applications.
